p: This project proposes the creation of a tokenized professional football club that will compete in the Uruguayan Football Association (AUF) and CONMEBOL tournaments.

The initiative combines real assets(player contracts and monetizable usage rights over sports facilities), professional club operations, and a transparent crypto structure, aimed at investors seeking exposure to Real World Assets (RWA) with high upside potential through football.
Fundraising Goal: USD 5,000,000 Purpose: Establish and operate a professional football club with tokenized ownership and a Buyback & Reward model
Uruguay is a historic producer of elite football talent and has a proven track record in professional football:
Low operational costs compared to European clubs
High player export rates to international markets
Access to AUF and CONMEBOL competitions

However, traditional football clubs lack transparency and accessible investment opportunities. This project seeks to democratize football club ownership through tokenization while building a competitive professional team.
Land available for sports city development
Founding team with UEFA certifications, international experience, and a multidisciplinary background driven by a deep passion for what we do.
Pathway to professional competition, with ongoing discussions with multiple clubs interested in joining the project, from which one strategic partner will be selected.
Introduction- Club structure, legal framework, and competitive model
Tokenomics- Token distribution, utility, and economics
Revenue Model- Income sources from club operations and player transfers
Governance- Transparency, multisig, and progressive decentralization
Team- Founding team and football expertise
Roadmap- Development timeline from club formation to CONMEBOL competition
Football is the asset. Crypto is the rail.

This project combines professional football, club ownership, and crypto responsibly. It's not a short-term promise, but a real value creation vehicle through a competitive football club with asymmetric return potential and strong anchoring in physical assets and sporting performance.

This project establishes a professional football club in Uruguay that will compete in the Uruguayan Football Association (AUF) and pursue participation in CONMEBOL tournaments (Copa Sudamericana, Copa Libertadores).
The club operates as a tokenized entity, allowing investors to participate in the economic success of a professional football team through transparent blockchain technology.
Sociedad Anónima Deportiva (SAD)- Sports Corporation constituted in Uruguay
The SAD is the legal entity that owns and operates the professional football club
The SAD holds permanent usufruct of the land to build the sports city and training facilities. Includes rights to use, economic exploitation, and sub-contracting.
The SAD manages all club operations: player contracts, competitions and commercial activities
Token holders will have the right to:
Benefit from the Buyback & Reward Pool(20-30% of Net Revenue funds token buybacks and staker rewards)
Participate in staking programs from Day 1
No guaranteed returns or minimum price
Progressive governance rights activated based on project milestones
Community advisory votes during early phases
Full strategic governance activated after operational maturity
No control over operational sports decisions at any stage
Sports city visits and match tickets
Tokens are transferable on secondary markets
Initial liquidity pool on DEX (TOKEN / USDT)
Protocol-owned liquidity, locked to prevent rug pulls
AUF registration, initial player contracts, competition fees, equipment
Technical staff, management, player salaries, operational costs

This allocation provides a 7+ year operational runway, significantly reducing pressure on early revenue generation and allowing the team to make long-term sporting decisions without financial urgency.
Training fields, gym, performance center, margin for overruns
The project includes 5+ years of full coverage for the team, with additional reserves and contingency buffers that extend the effective runway to approximately 7 years.
Target: Achieve operational self-sustainability in 24-36 months after the start of operations.
Design: Financial structure does not depend on hitting this target to survive. The extended runway ensures the club can weather delays, market conditions, or slower-than-expected revenue ramp-up.
Funds managed from a multisig wallet(3-of-5 signers)
Released in tranches based on milestone completion
All movements published on a public dashboard

Unlike purely speculative crypto projects, this initiative is backed by a real professional football club, competitive operations in AUF and CONMEBOL, and proven revenue models from player development and transfers in Uruguayan football.
DEX liquidity, future CEX, staking rewards, partnerships
Founders and core team, longest vesting
Long-term founder alignment with multi-year vesting tied to operational execution. Team vesting is the longest of all categories.
On-chain strategic reserve for future needs
Strategic advisors, KOLs, sales agents, commissions
Inner circle, football contacts, local investors
Total Fundraising Target:~ USD 5,000,000 Fully Diluted Valuation at Listing: USD 15,000,000
Early risk premium; Seed enters before SAD formation
Public gets immediate liquidity and no KYC
10% at TGE, 3-month cliff, then linear over 24 months
12-month cliff, then linear vesting over 36 months
15% at TGE, then linear over 18 months
30% at TGE, then linear over 9 months
6-month cliff, then linear vesting over 18 months
Distributed through staking and engagement programs
Locked, released by team decision with community advisory input
The founding team has the longest vesting of all categories(48 months). No buyer is locked longer than the team.
Initial market cap at TGE: ~ USD 1,380,000
Holders benefit from the Buyback & Reward Pool
20-30% of Net Revenue funds token buybacks from the open market
Bought tokens are distributed to active stakers and partially burned
Creates sustained buy pressure and reduces circulating supply over time
Token holders will gain progressive governance rights as the project matures
Governance is activated based on project milestones, not arbitrary timelines
Full strategic governance: activated after facility is operational and revenue is generated
No control over operational sports decisions at any stage
Stake tokens to earn rewards from the Community Rewards pool
Stakers receive priority in Buyback & Reward distributions
Staking available from Day 1 of TGE
Exclusive content access (training sessions, behind the scenes)
Sports city visits and match tickets
Early access to future products or rounds
Potential CEX listings in the future
USD 600,000 allocated for initial DEX pool (protocol-owned liquidity)
Liquidity locked to prevent rug pulls
Deployed at TGE on Solana DEX (Raydium, Orca, or Jupiter)
Buybacks from the Buyback & Reward Pool create sustained demand
Staking Programs incentivize long-term holding, reducing circulating supply
Gradual liquidity expansion as trading volume grows
No guarantees on liquidity, trading volume, or minimum price
20-30% of Net Revenue is allocated to the Buyback & Reward Pool each period
The Pool buys tokens from the open market(DEX), creating buy pressure
A portion of bought tokens is distributed to active stakers as rewards
A portion is burned, permanently reducing supply

Net Revenue= Gross revenue from all sources (player transfers, training rights, sell-on clauses, TV rights, and competition bonuses) minus direct operational costs (staff salaries, facility maintenance, competition fees, player development costs, and regulatory compliance).
Excluded: Capital expenditures funded from the initial raise are not deducted.
Minimum threshold: Pool does not activate if Net Revenue < USD 100,000 in the period
Negative periods: No debt accumulation. The Pool simply does not operate
Audit: Annual independent review, results published on-chain
Percentage decision: Set by the founding team (Phase 1-3), with community advisory input. Full community governance over the percentage is activated at a later milestone.
At each major project milestone, tokens from the Ecosystem reserve are permanently burned:
Burns reduce total supply, rewarding all holders with increased scarcity.
Training Rights- FIFA solidarity and compensation mechanisms
TV Rights & Competition Revenue- AUF and CONMEBOL distributions

This token does not promise guaranteed returns. It represents participation rights in a real-world business with inherent risks. Token value depends on project execution and market conditions. Only invest what you can afford to lose.
Sale of developed players to international clubs (South America, Europe, MLS, Middle East)
Transfer fees negotiated based on player performance and potential
Historical precedent: Uruguay is the world's leading exporter of elite talent per capita
Elite Level (Peñarol/Nacional): USD 5M - 15M+ per top prospect
Emerging Clubs: USD 300k - 1.5M per initial transfer (often plus sell-on)
Revenue Potential: High upside, variable timing
5% of transfer fees distributed to training clubs
Applies to all future transfers of players trained at our facility
Passive income stream from player career progression
Applies when players move between clubs
Negotiate percentage of future transfer fees
Compounds value as players progress in their careers
Player sold for USD 500k with 20% sell-on clause
Divisional A:~ USD 2,000,000 annually (New 2026-2029 cycle projections)
Guaranteed recurring revenue upon reaching professional categories
Participation in Copa Sudamericana: USD 250k - 500k+ per stage
Participation in Copa Libertadores: USD 1M - 3M+ for group stage

l: How Revenue Flows to Token Holders
p: Instead of direct revenue distributions, the project operates a Buyback & Reward Pool that creates sustained demand for the token while rewarding active participants.
20-30% of Net Revenue is allocated to the Buyback & Reward Pool each period
The Pool buys tokens from the open market(DEX), creating consistent buy pressure
A portion of bought tokens is distributed to active stakers as rewards
A portion is permanently burned, reducing total supply
For token price: Buybacks create real, sustained demand on the open market
For stakers: Active participants earn additional tokens as rewards
For all holders: Burns reduce supply, increasing scarcity over time
Transparency: All buybacks and burns are executed and verifiable on-chain

Net Revenue= Gross revenue from all sources (player transfers, training rights, sell-on clauses, TV rights, and competition bonuses) minus direct operational costs (staff salaries, facility maintenance, competition fees, player development costs, and regulatory compliance).
Excluded: Capital expenditures funded from the initial raise are not deducted.
Minimum threshold: Pool does not activate if Net Revenue < USD 100,000 in the period
Negative periods: No debt accumulation. The Pool simply does not operate that period.
Audit: Annual independent review, results published on-chain
Percentage decision: Set by the founding team during early phases, with community advisory input. Full community governance over the percentage is activated at a later milestone.
Primary Focus: Construction and team formation
Primary Focus: Promotion to professional ranks
Primary Focus: Domestic stability and CONMEBOL qualification
Revenue:~ USD 2M (TV Rights) + Player Transfers + CONMEBOL bonuses
Milestone: Operational self-sustainability and sustained buyback activity
We do not provide specific revenue projections due to the variable nature of player transfers and market conditions. Success depends on:
Proven Market: Uruguay has a track record of producing exportable talent
Professional Infrastructure: Modern facilities attract better talent
Experienced Team: AUF-certified and UEFA-certified coaches and international experience
Strategic Location: Access to South American and European markets
Extended Runway: 7+ years of operations funded, no forced decisions
Multiple revenue streams reduce dependency on single source
No forced sales due to cash pressure
All revenue, buybacks, and burns will be tracked on-chain and reported to the community regularly. Token holders will have full visibility into project finances through the public dashboard.
Modern gymnasium with strength and conditioning equipment
Network: Solana (initial deployment), with planned multichain expansion
High throughput and low transaction costs
Future interoperability with other major chains
Web3 wallet integration and social login
Responsive design for mobile and desktop
Our infrastructure will meet or exceed international standards for professional football training facilities, ensuring we can attract and develop top-tier talent.

The Premier Football project operates under a team-managed model with progressive decentralization. The founding team has full operational and strategic authority during the early phases, with governance rights being activated based on real project milestones.
All financial activity is managed through a multisig wallet and reported transparently on-chain.

Governance rights will be activated progressively as the project matures. During Phase 1-3, the founding team operates with full decision-making authority over sports and business operations. Community governance mechanisms will be introduced based on project milestones, not arbitrary timelines.
The founding team makes all operational, strategic, and financial decisions:
Coaching staff appointments and training methodologies
While the team operates with full authority, all activity is transparent:
Multisig wallet for all fund movements
On-chain tracking of all financial transactions
Public dashboard with project metrics and financials
Elected from Seed round top holders (activated post-Seed)
Threshold: 3 of 5 signatures required for execution
Recovery: 4 of 5 to replace a compromised or unavailable signer
Public dashboard: All movements published on-chain in real-time
5th signer activation: Investor representative joins after Seed round closes
Governance rights are activated based on real milestones, not timelines. This ensures governance is introduced when the project has the operational maturity to support it.
Community advisory votes (non-binding) on strategic direction
Binding community votes on Buyback & Reward Pool percentage (20-30%)
Binding votes on treasury allocation for expansion and new initiatives
Full strategic governance: community votes on major partnerships, expansion, and treasury strategy

l: What the Community Will Eventually Control
What the Community Will Never Control
p: Rationale: Sports decisions require professional expertise and cannot be effectively managed by committee vote. The founding team retains permanent operational autonomy to ensure competitive performance.
Token sale is restricted in: United States, China, North Korea, Iran, Cuba, and all OFAC/EU sanctioned jurisdictions.
AML screening for Seed and Private round participants
Terms and conditions with legal disclaimers at every point of sale
Legal counsel on retainer for regulatory monitoring
Participate in Token Sale— Join the Seed or Private round
Follow Progress— Track construction and operations via public dashboard
Join Community Calls— Monthly AMAs with the founding team
Provide Feedback— Share input through community channels
Advisory Votes— Participate in non-binding community polls
Binding Votes— Vote on Revenue Pool percentages and treasury allocation
Delegate Voting— Delegate your voting power to trusted community members
Submit Proposals— Create proposals for community consideration
Monthly: Community calls (AMAs) with founding team
Per Milestone: Public announcements and dashboard updates
Annually: Comprehensive review including independent revenue audit
Token metrics (circulating supply, burns, buyback activity)

We believe governance should be introduced when a project has proven it can operate, not promised at launch and never delivered. Our approach is to operate transparently from day one and progressively hand over strategic control as the project matures.
The project is led by a multidisciplinary team of professionals with UEFA certifications, Masters in Engineering, and international experience as players, coaches, and business developers.
Technical Expertise- UEFA certified coaches and Master’s in Engineering
Professional Development- Business developers and specialized psychologists
International Experience- Professional careers in multiple countries
Local Knowledge- Deep understanding of Uruguayan football ecosystem
Experience in player development across age groups
Proven track record of developing exportable talent
Club Relationships: Direct access to local clubs for partnerships
International Contacts: Connections with European and South American clubs
Scouting Network: Established talent identification channels
Player Development: Proven methodologies for talent cultivation
Performance Analysis: Data-driven approach to player improvement
Modern Training: Contemporary techniques aligned with European standards
Local Insight: Understanding of Uruguayan football culture
Transfer Market: Knowledge of player valuation and negotiation
Regulatory Expertise: Navigation of FIFA and local regulations
Multi-year operational runway secured from initial capital raise
Dedicated budget for technical, coaching, and management staff
Flexible allocation for specialized roles and performance needs
Designed to ensure long-term sustainability and execution capacity
Significant token allocation reserved for the founding and core team
Long-term vesting structure to guarantee execution commitment
Incentives tied to project growth and ecosystem value creation
"Build for the long term, not the quick exit."
Our team is committed to creating sustainable value over years, not months. We're building a real business with real assets, not a speculative token play.
This roadmap outlines a realistic, multi-year timeline for building sustainable football infrastructure and a functioning token economy.
We prioritize execution over hype and substance over speed.
Conduct token sale rounds (Seed, Private, Public)
Milestone token burn: construction complete (1M tokens)
Activate staking programs and community engagement

Milestone token burn: first competitive match (500k tokens)
Binding community governance on Pool percentage

Active token economy with buybacks and burns
This roadmap is built on conservative assumptions:
Construction may take longer than planned
Funds from the treasury are released based on milestone completion:
Site preparation, team expansion, construction start
Total: USD 5,000,000 — 100% allocated and traceable on-chain
Monthly: Community calls (AMAs) with founding team
Per Milestone: Public announcements and dashboard updates
Annually: Comprehensive review including independent revenue audit
Token metrics (circulating supply, burns, buyback activity)
This is a 5-10 year project, not a 6-month moon shot.
We're building real infrastructure and developing real talent. Success requires patience, professional execution, and community support.
If you're looking for quick returns, this is not the right project for you.
Multiple Facilities: Expand to additional locations
Regional Platform: Become the premier development hub in South America
International Network: Partnerships with top European and global clubs
Sustainable Ecosystem: Self-funding operations with consistent buyback and burn activity
Community Governance: Full strategic governance earned through milestones
Football is the asset. Crypto is the rail.

l: PFG Whitepaper Audit — Tokenomics & Crypto Launch Review
p: Date: February 2026 Scope: Full whitepaper review from the perspective of tokenomics design, crypto launch strategy, investor readiness, and regulatory risk. Status: Pre-launch (Phase 1: Foundation & Fundraising)

The project has strong fundamentals: real-world assets (land, player contracts), a proven market (Uruguayan football exports), conservative financial planning, and honest risk disclosures. The "Football is the asset. Crypto is the rail." positioning is well-calibrated.
However, several structural issues in the tokenomics, governance design, and regulatory positioning need to be addressed before going to market. These are solvable but critical.
Overall Rating: Promising foundation, needs refinement before fundraising.

l: Problem: Team allocation of 35% is well above market standards
p: Combined with governance (1 token = 1 vote, no cap), the team has de facto permanent majority control, which contradicts the DAO decentralization narrative.
Investors will flag 35% as excessive. It signals founder-heavy economics.
No dedicated ecosystem/treasury reserve means the project has zero on-chain budget for future incentives, grants, partnerships, or emergency allocations.

The Ecosystem & Treasury bucket gives the project on-chain reserves for future needs (partnerships, liquidity incentives, bug bounties, market making). Community Rewards provides tokens for staking programs already mentioned in the whitepaper.
FDV at launch ($7M) vs Raise ($3M)= 2.3x ratio. This is healthy and conservative. Good.
Step-ups: Founder→Community is 1.67x, Community→Public is 1.4x. Moderate and fair.

Price basis: The whitepaper does not explain how these prices were derived. Investors in the Founder Round will want to understand the valuation methodology (asset-backed? comparable project analysis? discount to projected revenue?).

Add a brief section explaining the valuation rationale. For an RWA project, tie it to the tangible assets: land value, projected facility value, comparable club valuations. This strengthens credibility enormously vs. arbitrary pricing.

l: 4. Vesting Schedule — Community Tokens Are Overly Restrictive

p: Investors who buy tokens in the Founder or Community round are being locked for 4 years with only 15% at TGE. This is extremely aggressive compared to market standards:
Investors buying at $0.03–$0.05 can't meaningfully exit for years
Combined with no revenue distributions until Year 4–6, early investors face potentially 4+ years of complete illiquidity with no returns
This will make fundraising harder, especially for the Community Round where participants expect more flexibility

This rewards earlier risk-takers with lower prices (not faster unlocks), while giving all buyers a more reasonable liquidity horizon. Team vesting should be longer than investor vesting to signal alignment.
With 15% TGE unlock on 60M sale tokens = 9M tokens enter circulation at launch.
Against $250k in DEX liquidity, this means:
If even 5% of unlocked holders sell ($0.07 * 450k tokens = ~$31.5k), that's 12.6% of the pool
A coordinated sell of 1–2M tokens could crash the price significantly

From month 13 onward, ~ 2.9M tokens/month enter circulation. At $0.07, that's ~$205k/month of potential sell pressure against a $250k liquidity pool. The pool would be drained in ~6 weeks if holders sold at market.
Increase initial liquidity allocation to $400–500k minimum
Implement a buyback reserve from day 1 (separate from the revenue buyback, which is years away)
Consider a protocol-owned liquidity (POL) strategy where LP tokens are owned by the treasury, not just locked
Add liquidity mining incentives to deepen the pool organically
The whitepaper states "Utility-focused, not security classification" but the primary utility IS revenue distribution, which is the defining characteristic of a security.
Under the Howey Test(US), MiCA(EU), and most international frameworks, this combination strongly resembles a security:
The project could face regulatory enforcement in major jurisdictions (US, EU, UK)
Exchanges (DEX and especially CEX) may refuse to list
Investors from certain jurisdictions may be legally barred from participating
Add clear disclaimers and IP-based access restrictions
Geo-block US and restricted jurisdictions from token sale
Higher compliance cost, but legally sound
Incorporate the token-issuing entity in a crypto-friendly jurisdiction (BVI, Cayman, Switzerland, UAE)
Instead, use staking rewards funded by buybacks (revenue buys tokens from market, distributes to stakers)
Limit sale to accredited investors or use Reg D/Reg S exemptions
Option A: Lean into the security classification

Option B is the most common approach in the industry and would significantly reduce regulatory risk while preserving the economic model. It's also more favorable for token price dynamics since buybacks create sustained demand.
Option B: Restructure to strengthen utility arguments
Remove direct revenue distribution from the token
Revenue accrues to token value through buybacks, not direct distributions
Structure as a regulated security token offering (STO)
The SAD operates in Uruguay for football operations
The token entity operates separately for token issuance
This makes the token a "work token" or "governance token" rather than a profit-sharing instrument
The whitepaper repeatedly references "20–30% of Net Revenue" but never defines what Net Revenue means.
Is it gross revenue minus ALL expenses (salaries, maintenance, construction)?
Does it include unrealized gains (e.g., player appreciation before sale)?
What happens in loss years? Does negative carry forward?
Are team salaries (paid from operations budget) deducted before the Revenue Pool calculation?
What about capital expenditures — are these deducted?
Add a clear definition, for example:

Net Revenue= Gross revenue from all sources (player transfers, training rights, sell-on clauses, TV rights, and competition bonuses) minus direct operational costs (staff salaries, facility maintenance, competition fees, player development costs, and regulatory compliance costs). Capital expenditures funded from the initial raise are excluded from this calculation.
Minimum threshold (e.g., no distribution if Net Revenue < $X)
The whitepaper presents a progressive decentralization path:
But the token distribution makes this impossible:

With 35% of votes, the team can unilaterally pass ANY proposal(35% > 15% quorum, 35%/35% = 100% > 66% threshold if no one else votes). Even with full participation, the team only needs to convince ~ 31% of other holders (for 66% threshold) or ~ 16% (for 51% threshold).
If team allocation is reduced to 20%, governance becomes more meaningful
Add a minimum participation threshold beyond quorum (e.g., proposals need at least 30% of non-team tokens participating)
Consider quadratic voting or conviction voting to reduce whale dominance
Define clear conditions for veto power removal in Phase 3 (not just "Year 4+" but specific, measurable criteria)
Set a maximum voting power cap per wallet (e.g., no single wallet can represent more than 10% of voting power)
The whitepaper mentions multisig treasury management multiple times but never specifies:
Who are the signers? All team members?
What happens if a signer is compromised or unavailable?
Is there a key rotation policy?
Define a specific structure, for example:
Key rotation every 12 months. Emergency recovery via 4-of-5 vote.
The whitepaper has zero mention of:
Know Your Customer (KYC) requirements for token buyers
Most serious launchpads and platforms require KYC
Lack of KYC is a red flag for institutional and accredited investors
Uruguay may require AML compliance for tokenized securities
Without KYC, the project is exposed to regulatory enforcement
KYC requirements for each round (at minimum for Founder Round)
Data protection policy (GDPR if targeting EU residents)

l: Items investors will expect to see
p: Mentioned in tech but not in tokenomics
No max holding or transaction limits

l: 12. Revenue Timeline vs. Investor Expectations Gap

p: This creates a 3–5 year dead zone where token holders have:
Create intermediate value drivers to bridge the gap:

Milestone-based token burns— At each major milestone (construction complete, first player signed, first transfer), burn a percentage of treasury tokens. This reduces supply and rewards holders with scarcity.
NFT/Membership utilities— Token holders get access to exclusive content, facility visits, match tickets, player meet & greets. This creates non-financial utility.
Staking with real rewards— Use a portion of the ecosystem reserve to reward long-term stakers during the pre-revenue period. This locks up supply and reduces sell pressure.
Transparent progress tracking— A real-time dashboard showing construction progress, player stats, financial metrics. Tangible proof of execution sustains holder confidence.
Revenue accrual reporting— Even before distributions, report on revenue generated and how the Revenue Pool is growing. This builds anticipation and demonstrates the model works.
Low fees ideal for small holders and frequent governance votes
Strong retail ecosystem and wallet penetration

"Upgradeable program model where appropriate"— This means the team can change the smart contract after deployment. For a revenue-sharing token, this is a trust concern. Specify which contracts are upgradeable and which are immutable. The Token contract should be immutable. Treasury and governance may be upgradeable with timelock.

Solana outages— Historically, Solana has experienced network outages. The whitepaper should acknowledge this risk and specify contingency plans (e.g., multichain deployment timeline, off-chain vote backup).

SPL Token vs Token-2022— Consider using Token-2022 (Token Extensions) which supports transfer hooks, transfer fees, confidential transfers, and metadata. This is more suitable for an RWA token that may need compliance features (e.g., transfer restrictions, freeze authority).
Specify which programs are immutable vs upgradeable
Define multichain expansion criteria and timeline

There is $1,550,000 unaccounted for in the milestone structure. The "Ongoing Operations: Monthly" is not quantified. This needs to be fully specified so investors know exactly when and how their funds are deployed.
Complete the fund release schedule with all $3M accounted for, including:
The whitepaper mentions competition in the risks section but doesn't address it strategically. Investors will want to know:
Are there other tokenized football clubs?
How does PFG compare to existing crypto-sports projects (Chiliz/Socios, fan tokens)?
What about traditional academies in Uruguay — how many? What do they charge?
Add a brief competitive analysis distinguishing PFG from:
Fan token platforms (Socios/Chiliz) — These are engagement tokens with no revenue sharing or real asset backing
Traditional Uruguayan academies — These lack transparent ownership and investor access
Other RWA tokenization projects — PFG is unique in combining sports operations with RWA tokenization
Reduce team allocation from 35% to 18–20%, add Ecosystem/Treasury reserve
Define "Net Revenue" precisely with auditing mechanism
Address securities classification risk (choose Option A, B, or C)
Restructure vesting: differentiate by round, reduce Community lock from 48 months
Increase liquidity allocation to $400–500k with POL strategy
Add valuation methodology for token pricing
Complete the fund release schedule ($1.55M unaccounted)
Add circulating supply chart showing monthly unlock schedule
Evaluate Token-2022 vs standard SPL Token
Define which smart contracts are upgradeable vs immutable
Add intermediate value drivers (burns, NFTs, staking, dashboard)
Add governance caps to prevent team voting dominance
Specify smart contract audit timeline and budget

This project is fundamentally well-conceived. The combination of Uruguayan football economics, tokenized RWA structure, and conservative financial planning is a strong thesis. The team's football credentials (UEFA certs, international experience) provide credibility that most crypto projects lack.

The main risks are not in the business model — they're in the token design and regulatory positioning. The good news is these are entirely fixable before launch. The recommendations above would transform this from a "promising but risky" whitepaper into one that institutional and sophisticated investors can take seriously.
The football thesis is sound. The crypto wrapper needs tightening.

l: Propuestas de Mejora — PFG Whitepaper v2
p: Basado en el audit + feedback del equipo. Raise target $5M. Sin DAO en el lanzamiento.

l: 1. Governance — Sin DAO, con roadmap de decentralizacion

p: El whitepaper describe una DAO completa (proposals, quorum, voting, delegation) que no existe y no va a existir al lanzamiento.

"Governance rights will be activated progressively as the project matures. During Phase 1-3, the founding team operates with full decision-making authority over sports and business operations. All financial activity is managed through a multisig wallet and reported transparently on-chain. Community governance mechanisms will be introduced based on project milestones, not arbitrary timelines."
Dashboard publico con metricas del proyecto
El equipo fundador opera el club y gestiona los fondos con:
El token otorga governance rights futuros, no actuales. El whitepaper debe ser claro:
governance.md→ reframe como roadmap de decentralizacion, no como feature actual
Multisig wallet (3-of-5) para todos los movimientos de fondos
Remover toda referencia a DAO como capacidad del lanzamiento en los demas archivos
Token utility: cambiar "Governance Rights" a "Future Governance Rights"
Advisors sube de 5% → 8% (cubre comisiones de venta y KOLs reales)
Estandar de industria, skin in the game fuerte
Reserva estrategica on-chain para futuras necesidades
Sale baja de 60% → 52% pero recauda mas porque los precios son mas altos
Se crean 3 buckets nuevos: Ecosystem (12%), Reserve (5%), Community (5%)
Team baja de 35% → 18% (elimina el red flag principal)
No hay community preexistente. La community se construye CON el launch, no antes. Estructura: Seed (red personal), Private (inversores estrategicos), Public (launchpad = adquisicion de comunidad).
A cambio: acceso a base de usuarios activos, marketing incluido, credibilidad de marca
Candidates: DAO Maker, Seedify, StarLaunch (Solana), AcceleRaytor (Raydium)
Comparable: fan tokens de clubes chicos lanzan a $20-50M FDV sin activos reales
Comparable: proyectos RWA sin operaciones lanzan a $10-30M FDV
Costo tipico: 5-8% de los tokens del round en fees al launchpad + allocation para su comunidad
Crypto funds (RWA focus), angels, football industry, LatAm investors
El equipo tiene credenciales verificables (UEFA certs)
El launchpad cumple la funcion de community building: trae miles de usuarios que se convierten en los primeros holders retail.
El launchpad es la estrategia de community acquisition, no un gasto sino una inversion
El terreno solo ya tiene valor tangible
Inner circle, contactos futbol, inversores locales, familia
Menos rondas = ejecucion mas rapida y simple.
No hay community para una "Community Round". Inventar una ronda para gente que no existe es deshonesto.
Parte del budget de $300k de Launch & Marketing cubre esto
PFG tiene tierra + equipo + pathway competitivo + modelo probado (futbol uruguayo)
SAD registrada en Uruguay = entidad legal con derechos reales

Step-ups (2.0x, 1.5x): Decrecientes. Seed toma mas riesgo y recibe el mejor precio. Private duplica porque ya hay traccion (Seed cerrado, SAD formada). Public paga premium por acceso sin KYC y liquidez inmediata.
Via launchpad (DAO Maker, Seedify, o Solana-native). El launchpad aporta la comunidad.
AUF registration, contratos iniciales, fees, equipamiento
Identificacion de talento, signing bonuses, trials
Liquidez +$350k: pool de $600k es serio, aguanta sell pressure real
Marketing $300k: podes hacer un launch real, no solo publicar un token
Mejor calidad de instalaciones, margen para imprevistos
Operations +$400k: ~ 7 anos de runway en vez de 5 — mucho menos presion
Reserve +$150k: buffer mas grande para lo inesperado
